Past_Perfect_Tense_key8: Fill in the correct form of the past perfect as in the examples.
Past_Perfect_Tense_key9: After Loren had turned on the alarm, she locked the door. (turn on)
Past_Perfect_Tense_key10: By the time Simone arrived, the police had already left. (arrive)
Past_Perfect_Tense_key11: Had you known about the contract they signed? (know)
Past_Perfect_Tense_key12: After the company _____Joe, he began to work on his first project. (hire)
Past_Perfect_Tense_key13: _you ___ the news before you saw it on TV? (hear)
Past_Perfect_Tense_key14: Michael didn’t want to see the movie because he _______ the book yet. (not read)
Past_Perfect_Tense_key15: The concert ______ already when we  the stadium. (begin/ enter)
Past_Perfect_Tense_key16: Until Anne ________ Mark, she ____ never ______in love. (meet, be)
Past_Perfect_Tense_key17: Bill __________ for years before he finally _______. (smoke/ quit)
Past_Perfect_Tense_key18: _______ Sara ever _______to London by herself before then? (drive)
Past_Perfect_Tense_key19: How many fish ______ the boys _____ by the time it started raining? (catch)
Past_Perfect_Tense_key20: You ________ them to go to the beach, hadn’t you? (forbid)
Past_Perfect_Tense_key21:
The girls _______ in weeks? That’s why they ______ so much afterwards. (exercise / hurt

Answers:-

had hired
Had/heard
hadn’t read
had/begun/entered
met/had/been
had smoked/quit
Had/driven
had/caught
had forbidden
hadn’t exercised / hurt
